item.description:
1 hr. 58 min. | R - strong violence, drug material, language, some sexual content and brief nudity

Cast: Joaquin Phoenix, Mark Wahlberg, Eva Mendes, Robert Duvall, Antoni Corone

Director: James Gray

Genre: Period Film, Crime Drama, Drama

In 1988, New York's police wage an all-out war on drugs, and guilty and innocent alike become casualties. Bobby Green (Joaquin Phoenix), manager of a nightclub that is often frequented by gangsters, tries to remain neutral but hides a potentially fatal secret: His brother (Mark Wahlberg) and father (Robert Duvall) are both cops. After his brother is wounded in an assassination attempt, Bobby can no longer remain neutral. He joins forces with his brother for an all-out assault on the mob.

Review: not yet.

Trailer: http://www.apple.com/...

Notes: Please do not rsvp yes if you do not intend to come. Please buy your tix AHEAD of time! I'm going to watch this regardless of people coming, but it's "funner" with people.

I will be going into the auditorium@7:30PM because the film begins @7:45PM.
The movie is upstairs, we'll be waiting near the table after you get off the escalator. Look for the red meetup sign. I'll try to grab a table.

After the film ends, I'll be waiting near the very first row of the big screen with a red Meetup sign. The group often goes out afterwards and socialize.
